location.merchant_description_html: Sometimes, going out to eat isn’t as meaningful as a family meal around your own dinner table. For the ingredients for a memorable home-cooked meal, head to the butchers at Savenor’s Market. The USDA Prime Rib Roast will make a beautiful centerpiece, and the marbled texture gives way to robust flavor. Back in her day, Julia Child would frequent Savenor’s for her cooking needs. The store is stocked with fresh products: sirloin, bacon, cheese and beans, even marinades. Let’s be honest... if it’s good enough for Julia, it’ll make for an astoundingly flavorful reason for your family to come together.

When you inhale the scent of freshly baked bread, emerging from the oven, your brain classifies that moment in the “It Doesn’t Get Better Than This” memory log. Then, your brain starts to fizzle when you spot the gourmet TBA Sandwich, layered with cool roasted turkey, bacon, herb mayo and avocado. It may take a calming glance at the Salad Bar before it returns to cognition. Telling you about the $6.95 Lunch Deal (sandwich, chips, drink AND a cookie) might be too much for you to process right now. Simon’s on 6th has caused your brain to create a new memory file: “WTH Just Happened!? Repeat Action Soon.”

Ali Baba masterfully sets his Middle Eastern cuisine amidst impressive ambiance. But which one is the top dog, the plates or the place? Let’s go head to head, shall we...What’s as exquisitely decorated as the desert-themed murals? The vibrantly adorned Greek Salad. Show me something as warm and inviting as the family-owners...and I’ll pass you the hot-from-the-oven basket of complimentary pita bread. What’s bigger than the heavily spiced Kufta Burger? The list of vegetarian-friendly menu items. Is there anything more celebrated than the Bring Your Own Bottle policy? A nearby puff of hookah answers your call. Let’s call the whole thing off and enjoy the best of both worlds. Capiche?

Simon says, “Drink quality coffee.” Following the rules of the simple, yet dire game, you spill your usual mass-produced swill and race to Porter Square with Paul Revere urgency. You’re headed to Simon’s Coffee. Traffic’s a-brewing, so you rip your whip into the secret lot on Linnean Street behind Rite Aid. Once you make it to the shop’s comforting chalkboard, you sigh in relief. In the quest for top-notch java, Simon makes room for...not one, but two reputable roasters: Terroir and Barisimo’s. Your cup is filtered and poured-over by baristas who hold championship titles in coffee making. As you take a game-winning sip Simon says, “Never settle for less.”

A karaoke machine. A giant high-heeled shoe. A nunchucked ninja... all made of cake. Judo-chop the center of that ninja and you’ll find soft layers of chocolate cake and cream cheese icing. It’s straight from the oven of The Cake and the Beanstalk. Get mom a classy, cursive’d cake for her birthday. Or, try a cake made entirely out of cupcakes (built-in portions!) But don’t forget to snag yourself a sweet treat: a Cappuccino is perfect for a slice of chocolate-glazed Chocolate Chip Pound Cake or gluten-free Cheesecake. #BakedBliss

When I hit up Nellie’s, I gotta wear my utility belt. On my left hip hangs a knife, which I whip out to downsize massive pieces of marinated meat on my Skirt Steak Salad. Left hip = fork, used to dive for Sweet Plantains. On Sundays, from 9AM-3PM, Nellie’s has the only Puerto Rican breakfast buffet in Chicago. I use a notepad to record my stats. For maximum efficiency, I snag a fresh Omelet first. When I get to the famous Avena de Coco, I unleash my silver spoon from its velvet case... it’s the only spoon worthy of this coconut-infused oatmeal dream. Now, how many bowls can I down before 3PM hits?

My husband looked at me quizzically, “Honey, did you take Spanish in High School?”  “No, why?”  “Last night you were speaking perfectly accented Spanish, murmuring on about cafe con leche.” I shrugged it off, but I knew I was dreaming about Cafe Colao. I make secret trips there to hang with my other family, the Colon’s. No, it’s not like that. The Colon’s own Cafe Colao and they’ve been setting me up with amazing Puerto Rican pastries. I am seeing about 5 different varieties of flan right now, it’s too hard to choose “the one.” I blind taste tested a Que Sito and really hit it off with the cream-cheese puff. As long as I clean up my to-go cup paper trail, I think I’ll get away with it.

"What's wrong with you?" my bestie asks. I'm swaying on my bed, looking like I have plastic googly eyes. "I just had My Blue Heaven, from Phil's." My bff knows what's up. I'm in a state of post-deli ecstasy, reeling from fried chicken drenched in buffalo sauce with blue cheese dressing, melted swiss, and all the fixings. My pre-googly eyes bigger than my stomach, I also had a side of Mac & Cheese Wedges. "Not again!" Yes, again and again until I experience every Boar's Head creation at Phil's Deli!

Experience authentic chai in San Francisco that conjure visions of India and its chaiwallas*. We sell fresh, made-from-scratch, lightly sweetened chai from two sidewalk carts in the Financial District in San Francisco - 545 Market St and 298 Market St.

Nomad Pizza is wandering the pizza plains into your heart. The gallivanting gypsy charms from storefront to food truck, luring you with wood-fire grilled Pizza Napolitana. Marvel at her San Marzano tomatoes, fresh mozzarella and basil. Her many irresistible wares are local, fresh, and authentic. As she rambles away from special events in her 1949 REO Speedwagon truck, she only leaves behind sweet marinara memories and your dancing belly.

Pronto Pizza is located next to the Civic Center and it’s here, standing behind a podium that we’d like to deliver their Ingredient Declaration of Differentiation: “We hold these truths to be self-evident that not all crusts are created equal. At Pronto, we believe you have a right to char, chew and the pursuit of a crispy bite. Furthermore, we believe in freedom. The freedom to choose your own toppings. All pies start with a sauce made from fresh, vine ripened tomatoes and basil. After that, it’s all you. If it’s your American dream to top your pizza with pinneaple, go for the Hawaiian. If you’d like to see seafood scattered on your tomato surface, the Tuna Pizza is your pick. This is a pizza democracy.”

You love your dog, so feed her a meal that loves her back. The Whole Dog sells a host of natural food to benefit your dog’s health. In-house nutrition experts can help you choose from brands like Nutrisca and Pure Vita, and healthy treats, too. Oh, and we hate to break it to ya, but that look in your dog’s eyes isn’t a plea for a good scratch behind the ears. It’s a cry for fashionable gear that will make other dog park go-ers jealous. Browse the selection of collars, leashes and beds that are safe, practical and totally stylish. It’s a dog eat dog world, and your pup will be killin’ the fashion game.

I strongly believe that all delicious hot dinners should also come in convenient to-go formats. An adult Lunchable if you will...sans the frolicking field trip of course. Think about the possibilities. Thanksgiving on a cracker. Spaghetti bars. Think I’m crazy? Bombay Wraps doesn’t. They’ve been mobilizing their meals for years. They offer Indian entree favorites, swaddled in easy-to-eat wraps, paratha to be exact! Chicken Tikka takes to the streets. Lamb Curry goes picnic-chic. And, samosas? Grab and go baby!

Before you become a contender in the Lower East Side’s version of Taxi Wars, take a breather at Mikey’s Burgers. Here in the retro shop, the menu is short, the hours are long (4AM) and the grill food’s reputation is undeniable. Opt for a classic Cheese Burger or let your tastebuds tackle a new flavor frontier with a tender Lamb Burger. And remember, the spicy mayo is good on ANY surface. After you’ve picked off your last Chili Fry and savored the last drop of Boylan Soda, you can officially consider your night capped.

Politics confuse me. Most of my very limited brain capacity is used up trying to decide what I’m gonna to eat for my next meal. I have, however, developed a sophisticated stance on Mexican-American Food Policy thanks to the inventive cuisine at Mexicue. Their Short-Rib Tacos with Memphis mole sauce, pickled onion and fresh cojita cheese illustrate how vitally important it is to allow a free flow of ideas across international borders. Mexican meets American BBQ; how could you possibly argue with that?! Take your party to one of their store front locations (Midtown West or Chinatown) or track their truck for curbside eats @Mexicue.

“Where does she go everyday?” I heard my interns whispering. I set out on my daily retreat off of Washington Street, down Malden to a kitty corner shop called South End Pita. The warm terracotta colored walls welcome me in as usual. I put in my order, a $5.50 falafel pita roll up. The ground garbanzo bean patties are seasoned and flash fried right in front of me. It’s not fast food, it’s custom food. A few minutes later, I’m soaking up the sun at a picnic table at Union Park Playground enjoying my wrap, anxiously awaiting a bite of my homemade honey baklava. This is Boss Lady’s moment of weakness.
location.merchant_name: South End Pita / Mass Ave Pita

location.merchant_name: South End Pita / Mass Ave Pita

location.merchant_description_html: When my boyfriend cancelled our lunch date, I was pissed. After I got his text, I decided to make him pay. Then the photo shoot commenced: me, sinking my teeth into a juicy Meatball Panini with sauteed spinach. Me, licking the Vegan Lasagna I’d ordered for him off my fork. Me, gorging on Chocolate Cream Puffs. When he didn’t respond to my jealousy-inducing picture message raid, I knew I had to use my secret weapon. I sent one last pic. His response: “Is that a cannoli ON TOP of a cupcake?!” Bet he won’t stand me up for Open Mic Night on Wednesday. #HookLineSinker
LevelUp Cafe

It’s dog eat dog out there. “Did you see Jen’s instagram photo of that log cabin of cannolis?” “Whatever! Mine’s better. This turkey panini pic was banging! Red peppers and avocado, the cheese running over. I barely even had to X-Pro that baby before muploading.” Come on guys, can’t we just get along? In the end, as long as we’re all enjoying sweet Italian pastries and juicy, flavorful paninis can’t we be happy? Alright then, meet me at Al Teatro Panini Grill and let’s dig in! But wait... lemme snap a pic first.

Chocolate and strawberry are so... vanilla. Leave it to Brooklyn to house the exotic destination for sweet and savory satisfaction. SkyIce whips up a rotation of dazzling flavors with a Thai twist, like Black Sesame Seaweed, Avocado, and Thai Iced Tea. To go where no dessert has gone before, try the sushi-inspired Winter Roll: rice paper and sweet coconut rice wrapped around lychee, strawberry, and kiwi. If you’re feeling shy (you won’t once you take a bite), they’ve got explosive traditional Northern Thai dishes like Pad Thai, Satay and Curries! Savory hates to be upstaged by Sweet...

Throughout most of the country, delis strive to be "New York-style." That's why tri-staters are lucky to have delis like Raf crafting up hot, cold, and specialty sandwiches on wraps, rolls, and heroes. Take the Hoboken Delight for example: thin slices of roast beef and turkey with lettuce, tomato, and Russian dressing. Right off the HBLR, there's just no reason to miss out. With Thumann's meats, it's R.A.F, real and fresh. Could that be the mystery namesake acronym? Or, Right At First st.? Refer A friend? D. All of the above.

Windy City Sweets has turned Willy Wonka mint green with envy. What makes this fully functioning chocolate factory so sweet? I’ll tell you...but only if I can have a chocolate covered s’more for each reason. Agreed? Ok, here we go: A floor-to-ceiling candy wall.  Ice cream cones made out of salted pretzels (and ice cream to go with them.) Old-time brands that can still evoke an ear-to-ear grin... I’m talking to you Necco wafers! A carefully curated library of Jelly Bellys. Unforgettable fudge. And, an owner who’s still as sweet and upbeat as the day he started in 1983. That’ll be 7 s’mores please.

The color red usually means “STOP,” but when you spot the red umbrellas at Caffe Baci... it’s in your best interest to sprint. It’s a modern Italian food extravaganza. Snag a ticket to the Baci’s Signature Sandwich show: mozzarella and imported prosciutto support a healthy stack of marinated artichoke hearts and plum tomatoes. Every great Pizza-filled, Panini-pressed show deserves an encore. The Bar @ Caffe Baci on W. Wacker sets things off with beer, colorful cocktails and impressive bar bites like Chipotle Shrimp, sauteed in tequila.  Break out your inhalers, food lovers. This just got real.

I’m sick of soggy souvlaki and dull dolmathes: where are the talents of Greek cuisine? The answer comes in a name: Demetrios Moraitis of Mr. D’s Greek Delicacies. His yeeros (spelled so to avoid ordering confusion) are giant mounds of meat & veggies, rolled into a warm pita cone. Or try a wedge of spanikopita, which may have you swearing off spinach served any other way. Need more proof of Mr. D’s talent? Check out his detailed sculptures made from, yes, yeero meat. The Mona Lisa in yeero? Now that’s a medium I can get behind.

Wanna be surprised? At Elements Cafe, the menu only describes the main ingredients in their tapas dishes (ex. Bisque with shrimp and sherry, Short Rib with polenta and smoked mozzarella.) They prepare your meal fresh and surprise you with how they use each ingredient! Plus, the deals are real. Tues-Fri, from 11:30AM-2PM, hit the ultimate Budget Beater: only $6 for a featured salad or sandwich. Fine dining meets affordability when you stop by for Sunset Dinner... Tues-Thurs from 4:30-6PM. You pay only $15 for a first course, main course, and OF course, a dessert. Creme Brulee never stood a chance...

Oh, so you think you’re a Wise Guy? Well riddle me this... how many ingredients are bun’d between the bread of a Big Nasty Sandwich? If you guessed anything lower than five, you aren’t ready for this sloppy, soul-satisfying pile of sandwich. It’s got chicken fingers, onion rings, fries, steak, American cheese and a bit of whiz... I caught that twitch in your jaw, I know it’s intimidating. Start with training wheels: Mac & Cheese Bites. Soon you can upgrade to Cranberry Chicken Salad and eventually a Philly Cheese Steak Pizza. Get some food-taming experience under your belt, then hit me up.
